alert.note: Alert for Crook (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 26 at 6:27PM MDT until August 26 at 7:15PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM MDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN BUTTE...LAWRENCE AND EAST CENTRAL CROOK COUNTIES... At 626 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles southeast of Colony to 2 miles south of Aladdin to 6 miles southeast of Cook Lake, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Beulah, Belle Fourche, Belle Fourche Reservoir, Fruitdale, Crow Peak, Arpan, Iron Creek Lake, Bridal Veil Falls, Savoy, Spearfish, Nisland, Saint Onge, Spearfish Canyon, Whitewood, Central City, Lead and Deadwood. This includes... Interstate 90 in South Dakota between Mile Markers 1 and 28. Interstate 90 in Wyoming between Mile Markers 193 and 207. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure.
